intro: Austrobryonia argillicola, commonly known as the clayland liverwort, is a small, mat-forming liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its delicate, leaf-like structures called thallus. The plant thrives in clay soils, often in forest understories or along stream banks. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are small and inconspicuous, typical of many liverworts. Austrobryonia argillicola plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native range.
